intro: Hieracium solhemense, commonly known as the Solhemense Hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe, particularly found in moist meadows and grasslands. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters, with lance-shaped leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Hieracium solhemense is known for its hairy stems and is often found in calcareous soils, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitats.
